attributes.action: Maintain requirement for Face Coverings as other restrictions are lifted
attributes.additional_details:
While we recognise that it is important for society and the economy to be able to return to more pre-COVID ways of working, we must remain mindful and aware of the continuing risks of COVID.
In order to allow the full opening of the economy, whilst also protecting the public and the NHS, a really simple measure is to maintain the requirement to wear a mask or face covering in enclosed public spaces. COVID is not gone, and we risk further mutations by allowing it to spread unchecked.
attributes.background: As lockdown restrictions continue to be lifted, we ask that the requirement to wear a face covering in enclosed public spaces is kept in place, to help protect the public and our NHS. Keeping this final measure in place will help prevent a severe increase in cases and reduce deaths.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Keep face covering mandatory in indoor public settings beyond 19th July 2021: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/590616

Keep mandatory face coverings in supermarkets and on public transport: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/590836
 
Keep face masks mandatory for public transport after the lifting of restrictions: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/590694

Keep requirement to wear a face covering in shops & supermarkets after July 19th: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/590829
